title: 91/139/EEC: Commission Decision of 28 February 1991 authorizing Germany to specify a minimum number of animals in the case of applications for premiums for maintaining suckler cows (Only the German text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 28 February 1991  authorizing Germany to specify a minimum number of animals in the case of applications for premiums for maintaining suckler cows  (Only the German text is authentic)  (91/139/EEC)
THE COMMISSION  OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Germany is hereby authorized to stipulate that the applications for the premium for suckler cows which are submitted as from 15 June 1991 must each concern three animals or more.
This Decision is addressed to the German Federal Republic.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 28 February 1991.
For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
